result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherrie Ann Cadd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Sherrie Ann Cadd in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matters are set for trial on 9/30.
BTC:  Trial remains.
ZCI report
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 7-6-2015:    Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.**

Defendant Sherrie Ann Cadd in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matters were set for Miranda/Goodchild and Motion to Join.
Defense will stip to admissibility of statement and does not object to joinder.
BTC:  Statements are admissible.  Motion to Join is granted.
Defense req bond mod to reduce cash.
State does not object to reduction of cash bond but notes that SCRAM was removed due to non-payment.  Req that SCRAM be reinstalled.
BTC:  Bond mod to reduce cash to $1000 cash each file.  Def must attend 5 mtgs/wk.  SCRAM is removed.  Defendant must test after each court appearance.
